availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, plumber. Kentucky native. Plumber in Louisville in 1860. Plumber in partnership with John F. Donaly in Donaly & Strader from 1860 to 1863. Plumber in Charles M. Strader & Company in Louisville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 5 , p. 165.
"Donaly & Strader," The Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, KY), 27 Jan 1860, p. 2.
Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 ed. Henry Tanner (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 75, 239.
"Water! Water!" Daily Courier, (Louisville, KY), February 4, 1861, p. 1.
"Dissolution," The Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, KY), February 14, 1863, p. 2.
"Bade Defiance to Gabriel," Pittston Gazette, (Pittston, PA), March 30, 1904, p. 1.
"His Ashes," The Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, KY), April 1, 1904, p. 7.
Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 ed. Henry Tanner (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 75, 239.
